problems.description: You are given the list of edges of a directed graph and the root node. Perform breadth first search to find the correct order of visitation of nodes. You are advised to first construct a graph from the edge list then proceed further.
problems.inputs description: Input consists of an array of edges -inp1 as [node1, node2]. For node1 as parent, The first of the edges denote the edge with the left child, other latter edge with the right child. The other input is the root node - inp2
problems.expected description: An array of nodes in the correct order of visitation

problems.description: You find yourself in a maze represented by a grid of cells. Each cell is either passable (0) or blocked by a wall (1). You start at the top-left corner of the maze and must find the shortest path to the bottom-right corner using only horizontal and vertical moves. If there is no valid path, return -1.
problems.inputs description: A 2D array grid where 0 represents a passable cell and 1 represents an obstacle. The start point is grid[0][0] and the end point is grid[4][4].
problems.expected description: An integer representing the length of the shortest path from the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner, or -1 if no such path exists.
